5 fun things this week

Louisville 8:16 a.m. EST November 19, 2014

Important schedule.(Photo: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

CONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

North American International Livestock Exposition. Kentucky Exposition Center, 937 Phillips Lane, Thursday and Friday. $6, $3 seniors and ages 12 and younger. Parking, $8, $20 bus. For a complete schedule www.livestockexpo.org/schedule.aspx.

23rd Annual Holiday Gift Show: Temptations. Olmsted, 3701 Frankfort Ave., 10 a.m.-7 p.m. Thursday. More than 30 juried vendors with antiques, clothing, gifts, pillows, pottery, paper, photography, stationery, handbags, jewelry, food and more. The Multiple Sclerosis Society will host a penny social — purchase a ticket and place it in a jar in front of the item desired. Different items each day. Proceeds to benefit the National Multiple Sclerosis Society Kentucky/Southeast Indiana Chapter. Lunch is available. Merchants list is available online. temptationsholidayboutique.com.

Derby City Comic Con: Cavalcade of Comics. Triple Crown Pavilion, Ramada Plaza Louisville, 9700 Bluegrass Parkway, 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Saturday. $5. derbycitycomiccon.com.

Conrad Caldwell House Museum Holiday Decor Party. 1402 St. James Court, 1-4 p.m. Sunday. Help decorate tress in the museum. Light refreshments will be available.

Holiday Cocktail Class. Westport Whiskey & Wine, 1115 Herr Lane, 7 p.m. Monday. Joy Perrine, co-author of "The Kentucky Bourbon Cocktail Book," will have demonstrations on making cocktails. Seating is limited. $15, $10 for Tasting Club members. Reservations required, (502) 708-1313.

BARS & CLUBS: 5 spots for live music

TAKE THE KIDS: Top fun things for families

ON STAGE: 5 productions now playing

CONCERTS: Top shows to check out

And lots more stuff to do ...

Events

North American International Livestock Exposition. Kentucky Exposition Center, 937 Phillips Lane, Thursday and Friday. $6, $3 seniors and ages 12 and younger. Parking, $8, $20 bus. For a complete schedule www.livestockexpo.org/schedule.aspx.

Spalding University's Festival of Contemporary Writing. Fall-spring reading series will be held Thursday-Saturday, The Brown Hotel, 335 W. Broadway, and Spalding's Egan Leadership Center, 901 S. Fourth St. The festival features readings by faculty, guests and alumni of Spalding University's low-residency Master of Fine Arts in Writing Program. Readings and events are free. For a complete schedule, spalding.edu/mfa; (502) 873-4400.

23rd Annual Holiday Gift Show: Temptations. Olmsted, 3701 Frankfort Ave., 10 a.m.-7 p.m. Thursday. More than 30 juried vendors with antiques, clothing, gifts, pillows, pottery, paper, photography, stationery, handbags, jewelry, food and more. The Multiple Sclerosis Society will host a penny social — purchase a ticket and place it in a jar in front of the item desired. Different items each day. Proceeds to benefit the National Multiple Sclerosis Society Kentucky/Southeast Indiana Chapter. Lunch is available. Merchants list is available online. temptationsholidayboutique.com.

Conrad Caldwell House Museum Holiday Decor Party. 1402 St. James Court, 1-4 p.m. Sunday. Help decorate tress in the museum. Light refreshments will be available.

Derby City Comic Con: Cavalcade of Comics. Triple Crown Pavilion, Ramada Plaza Louisville, 9700 Bluegrass Parkway, 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Saturday. $5. derbycitycomiccon.com.

Spectator sports

University of Louisville Cardinals vs. Belmont University. KFC Yum! Center, 1 Arena Plaza, 7 p.m. Thursday. Women's basketball. $10. (800) 745-3000.

University of Louisville Cardinals vs. Marshall. KFC Yum! Center, 1 Arena Plaza, 9 p.m. Friday. Men's basketball. $41. (800) 745-3000.

Churchill Downs. 700 Central Ave., 12:40 p.m. Thursday-Sunday and Nov. 26. $3. (502) 636-4400.

University of Louisville Cardinals vs. Ball State University. KFC Yum! Center, 1 Arena Plaza, 2 p.m. Sunday. Women's basketball. $10. (800) 745-3000.

Thanksgiving dining

Austin's. 4950 U.S. 42. Thanksgiving buffet with turkey, ham, mashed potatoes, dressing, sweet potato casserole, corn, green beans, corn, salad, rolls and desserts. $19.95, $8.95 for ages 4-10, free for ages 3 and younger; carryout meal for $16.95. Reservations, (502) 423-1990.

Blu Italian Grille. Marriott Downtown, 280 W. Jefferson St., will offer a buffet with seatings at noon, 1, 2, 3 and 4 p.m. The meal includes appetizers, egg and waffle station, pasta station; carving station, turkey and prime rib; entrees, pomegranate and wild flower honey glazed salmon, Kentucky country ham, roast garlic mashed potatoes, green bean casserole, creamed corn and desserts. $39 for adults, $19 for ages 4-11 and complimentary for ages 3 and younger. Reservations are requested. (502) 671-4285.

Derby Dinner Playhouse. 525 Marriott Drive, Clarksville, Thursday. Enjoy the show ("A Wonderful Life") and a Thanksgiving buffet. Buffet, 11:45 a.m.-1 p.m.; show 1:30 p.m. $41. (5812) 288-8281.

Golden Corral. Open Thanksgiving Day; 4032 Taylorsville Road, (502) 485-0004; 5362 Dixie Highway, (502) 447-6660; 8013 Preston Highway, (502) 966-4970.

J. Graham's Cafe, The Brown Hotel, 335 W. Broadway, will offer seatings at 11:15 to 11:45 a.m. and 1:15-1:30 p.m. Thursday. The buffet includes soups, variety of fall salads, imported meat and pickled vegetable bar, fresh seafood, carving stations with roasted turkey and Kentucky ham and an assortment of domestic and imported cheeses. Additional options include seared Atlantic salmon, buttermilk mashed potatoes, sweet potatoes with candied pecans, charred vegetable medley, fig and apple stuffing and desserts. $37, plus tax and gratuity, $17 for ages 4-12 and complimentary for ages 3 and younger. Reservation required, (502) 583-1234, ext. 7225.

J. Harrods, 7507 Upper River Road. Buffet 11:30 a.m.-4 p.m. $21.95, $10.95 for ages 12 and younger. Reservations, (502) 228-4555.

KT's. 2300 Lexington Road. Thanksgiving buffet with turkey, ham, mashed potatoes, dressing, green beans, corn, cranberry relish, rolls and dessert. $19.95, $9.95 for ages 4-10, free for ages 3 and younger. (502) 458-8888.

Spirit of Jefferson Thanksgiving Cruise. River Road, board at 12:30 p.m.; cruise 1-3 p.m. Thanksgiving Day. Traditional Thanksgiving meal. $48, $32 for ages 3-12. (502) 574-2992.

Village Anchor. 11507 Park Road. Turkey takeout, a feast for six or more with a whole turkey, cornbread dressing, green bean casserole, cranberry sauce, mashed potatoes, sweet potato casserole, dinner rolls and pumpkin pie. $25 per person. Order (in increments of six, 12, 18) by Friday. Meals will be ready for pick-up Nov. 26. (502) 708-1850.

Tastings

Wine & Whiskey Night. Westport Whiskey & Wine, 1115 Herr Lane, 6-8 p.m. Thursday. River City Distributing will offer some special treats. Wines with global influence from Europe and Americas and a couple of craft beers. $3 by-the-glass, $2 whiskeys.

Holiday Cocktail Class. Westport Whiskey & Wine, 1115 Herr Lane, 7 p.m. Monday. Joy Perrine, co-author of "The Kentucky Bourbon Cocktail Book," will have demonstrations on making cocktails. Seating is limited. $15, $10 for Tasting Club members. Reservations required, (502) 708-1313.

Steve Patton of Trinchero Family Wines Estates. Westport Whiskey & Wine, 1115 Herr Lane, 7 p.m. Tuesday. A tasting of bold wines from their portfolio. $15, $10 for Tasting Club members. Reservations required, (502) 708-1313.

Film

Planetarium shows. Gheens Science Hall & Rauch Planetarium, 108 W. Brandeis Ave. $8, $6 for ages 12 and younger, seniors and University of Louisville students. (502) 852-6664.

Friday: "BIG," 8 p.m.; "Laser Beatles," 9 p.m.; "Dynamic Earth," 10 p.m.; "Laser U2," 11 p.m.

Saturday: "Perfect Little Planet," 1 p.m.; "Laser Magic," 2 p.m.; "Black Holes: The Other Side of Infinity," 3 p.m.

Dances

Nuts N Honeys Dance Club. Dance Louisville, 8023 Catherine Lane, 7-11 p.m. Friday. Beginner and intermediate line dancing and couples dancing. $5. (502) 643-2786 or bigalofamerica@aol.com.

Singles Dance. Moose Lodge, 4615 Fegenbush Lane, 7:30-11 p.m. Sunday. Music by Kenny Sauter's Masters of Music DJ Service. Door prizes. $6 before 8 p.m.; $7 after 8. (502) 736-7600.

Exhibits

21c Museum Hotel. 700 W. Main St. "Transporting Transformation: Cuba, In and Out," by Jose Toirac, Sandra Ramos and others; "Chito Yoshida: Love for Sale," by Chito Yoshida; "A Thirsty Switch Still Quivers For Me," by Gina Phillips. "Burnouts," by Julia Christensen. All end April 2015. (502) 217-6300.

Actors Theatre of Louisville Gallery. 316 W. Main St. "Kentucky Watercolor Society: Aqueous USA 2014," 37th annual juried exhibition. Ends Dec. 23.

The Arts Council of Southern Indiana. 825 E. Market St. "The Party in My Head," by Kent Epler. Ends Jan. 10.

Asia Institute Crane House. 1244 S. Third St. "Poking the Lillies Pad," ceramic works by nationally recognized, emerging Asian American artists. Ends March 15.

Bridge Gallery. Mellwood Art Center, 1860 Mellwood Ave. "Seasons," by Carol Labashosky. Ends Dec. 15.

Carnegie Center for Art & History. 201 E. Spring St., New Albany. "Earth-Tones: Art Quilts," by Penny Sisto. Ends Jan. 10.

Conrad-Caldwell House Museum. 1402 St. James Court. "Louisville's River." Ends May 31, 2015.

Craft(s) Gallery. 572 S. Fourth St. "la Vida, la Muerte y el Amor" (Life, Death, and Love), new works by Sarah and Jeral Tidwell. Ends Friday.

Filson Historical Society. 1310 S. Third St. "Steamboating on Western Waters." Ends Dec. 30. (502) 635-5083.

Flame Run Gallery. 815 W. Market St. Works by Steven Ciezki. Ends Saturday.

Frazier History Museum. 829 W. Main St. "Lifestyles of the Rich & Famous: Art, Fashion & Luxury During the Gilded Age." Ends Feb. 1. "Irving Berlin's White Christmas: The Exhibit." Ends Jan. 11.

Gadabout Gallery and Artisan Shoppe. 249 Spring St., Jeffersonville. "Gifted: 50 Artworks Under $50." Ends Nov. 30.

The Gallery at Mann and Fox. Professional Towers, 401 Dupont Circle, Suite 505. "The Art of Embroidery," by Bette Levy. Ends Dec. 31.

Gallery Janjobe. Mellwood Arts Center, 1860 Mellwood Ave. "Presents! Presents!," one-of-a-kind gifts by gallery artists and guest artists. Opens Nov. 25. Reception Nov. 28 during all-day FAT Friday Trolley Hop. Ends Jan. 25.

Garner Narrative Contemporary Fine Art. 642 E. Market St. "Deconstructing Melancholy," by Aleksandra Stone. Ends Nov. 28.

The Green Building. 732 E. Market St. "Incommunicado," a three-dimensional exhibit by Amy Chase, Patrick Donley and Brad White. Ends Nov. 28.

Heart Gallery. 902 E. Washington St. "Core Constellation," by Amy Stephens McClain. Ends Nov. 28.

Horseshoe Gallery. Horseshoe Casino, 11999 Casino Center Drive, Elizabeth, Ind. "Delectable." Ends Dec. 31.

Huff Gallery. Spalding University, 853 Library Lane. "Ligne Rouge." Ends Dec. 19.

Indiana University Southeast Barr Gallery. 4201 Grant Line Road. "The Life of Brian: A 36 Year View," by Brian H. Jones. Ends Saturday.

Jane Morgan Gallery. 4838 Brownsboro Center. "Paths in Nature." Ends March 14, 2015.

Jeffersontown Historical Museum. 10635 Watterson Trail. Historic photos and artifacts. Ends Dec. 19.

Kaviar Forge & Gallery. 1718 Frankfort Ave. "Abstract in Kentucky." Ends Jan. 3.

Kentucky Derby Museum. 704 Central Ave. "Horse Play," highlighting the playful side of the Kentucky Derby and featuring historical equine toys, digital interactives and music created for the museum. Ends Dec. 31. (502) 637-1111.

Kentucky Science Center. 727 W. Main St. "The World We Create." Permanent exhibit that explores science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) through collaborative and open-ended challenges.

Kentucky Watercolor Society Gallery. 4836 Brownsboro Road. "Celebrating the Season in Watercolor." Ends Jan. 31.

Kore Gallery. 1860 Mellwood Ave. Works by Thom Eckert. Ends Nov. 26.

Local Speed. 822 E. Market St. "Remix: Stephen Paul Day, Sibylle Peretti, The Leight Collection." Ends Feb. 21.

Louisville Free Public Library. 301 York St. "Black Freedom, White Allies and Red Scare: Louisville, 1954." Ends Nov. 29.

Metro Hall. 527 W. Jefferson St. "Infinite Perspectives," by Ann Stewart Anderson, Ashley Brossart and Dhamin Jassim. Ends Jan. 16.

Paul Paletti Gallery. 713 E. Market St. "Small Worlds," photographs by Margaret Oechsli. Ends Dec. 29.

Peyton Samuel Head Family Museum. Oldham County History Center, 106 N. Second St., La Grange. "I Pledge Allegiance: Honoring Our World War II Veterans." Ends March 22, 2015.

Portland Museum. 2308 Portland Ave. Works by Julius Friedman. Ends Dec. 23.

Pyro Gallery. 909 E. Market St. Opening Thursday, "Esthesia," by Carrie Burr, Paula Keppie and Wendi Smith. Reception Friday, 6-9 p.m. Ends Dec. 27.

Revelry Boutique Gallery. 742 E. Market St. "Louisville Noir," photographic portrait series by Tom LeGoff. Ends Dec. 4.

Tim Faulkner Gallery. 1512 Portland Ave. "Lines" a new collection of oil paintings by Jen Goodell. Ends Dec. 14.

Wayside Expressions Gallery. Wayside Christian Mission, 120 W. Broadway. "Colors," by Creative Diversity Studios. Ends Dec. 2.

Zephyr Gallery. 610 E. Market St. "Project 5: Stranger Than Function." Ends Dec. 20.

Other attractions

Lazer Blaze. 4121 Shelbyville Road, Friday, 4 p.m.-midnight; Saturday, 10 a.m.-midnight; Sunday, noon-9 p.m.; Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, 4-9 p.m. Laser tag, laser tag museum, arcade, cafe. $7 per game, $12 for two games. (502) 895-2985.

Robben's Roost. 5906 Six Mile Lane, Friday, 7-11 p.m.; Saturday, 1-4 and 7:30-10:30 p.m.; Sunday, 1-4 p.m.; Tuesday and Thursday, 11 a.m.-1 p.m. Roller skating. Fridays, $6; Saturday afternoons, $4, evenings, $5; Sundays, $4; Tuesdays and Thursdays, $3. (502) 491-8170.

Skate World. 6310 Preston Highway, 7-11 p.m. Fridays; 1-4 and 7-11 p.m. Saturdays; 1-4 p.m. Sundays, Tuesdays and Thursdays. Roller skating. Friday and Saturday evenings, $5; Saturday and Sunday afternoons, $4; Tuesdays and Thursdays, $3. (502) 969-6000.

Wheel Fun Rentals. Waterfront Park. 10 a.m.-7 p.m. Saturday and Sunday. Bike rentals: cruisers, tandems, choppers, quad sports, deuce coupes, four-wheel surrey bikes. Group rates available. www.wheelfunrentals.com.

Open Range Sports. 6401 Cross Keys Blvd., Crestwood, 4-8 p.m. Friday; 11 a.m.-8 p.m. Saturday; noon-5 p.m. Sunday. Indoor paintball/reball and a gun range. (502) 243-8282; www.openrangesports.com.
